body:
### Describe the bug

I tested using the same code as the collatz example and line_profiler<4.

```py
@cython.binding(True)
def collatz1(np.uint64_t n):
    while n > 1:
        if n % 2 == 0:
            n //= 2
        else:
            n = 3*n+1

ctypedef fused fused_t:
    np.int32_t
    np.int64_t

@cython.binding(True)
def collatz2(fused_t n):
    while n > 1:
        if n % 2 == 0:
            n //= 2
        else:
            n = 3*n+1

```


```py
func = collatz1
profile = line_profiler.LineProfiler(func)
profile.runcall(func, 19)
assert_stats(profile, func.__name__)


func = collatz2
profile = line_profiler.LineProfiler(func)
profile.runcall(func, 19)
assert_stats(profile, func.__name__)
```

I get the following output:

```
Total time: 1.6e-05 s
File: collatz.pyx
Function: collatz1 at line 11

Line #      Hits         Time  Per Hit   % Time  Line Contents
==============================================================
    11                                           def collatz1(np.uint64_t n):
    12         1          6.0      6.0     37.5      while n > 1:
    13        20          5.0      0.2     31.2          if n % 2 == 0:
    14        14          3.0      0.2     18.8              n //= 2
    15                                                   else:
    16         6          2.0      0.3     12.5              n = 3*n+1

Timer unit: 1e-06 s

Total time: 0 s
File: collatz.pyx
Function: collatz2 at line 23

Line #      Hits         Time  Per Hit   % Time  Line Contents
==============================================================
    23                                           def collatz2(fused_t n):
    24                                               while n > 1:
    25                                                   if n % 2 == 0:
    26                                                       n //= 2
    27                                                   else:
    28                                                       n = 3*n+1

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "test_profile.py", line 33, in <module>
    assert_stats(profile, func.__name__)
  File "test_profile.py", line 16, in assert_stats
    assert len(timings) > 0
AssertionError
```

### OS

MacOS

### Python version

3.8.8

### Cython version

Cython==0.29.24

### Additional context

line-profiler==3.5.1 as per https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/5141

Sister thread on line_profiler: https://github.com/pyutils/line_profiler/issues/213
title: [BUG]  Fused types cause line_profiler to not measure any timing
